comment: I took professor SP for senior project, she was great despite being noticeably overworked. She cared a lot of each students success, and helped nudge us in the right direction academically and professionally all semester long. I highly recommend this professor if you come across her, as she is one of the best in the department.

Professor Perry, is such a great professor. Her assignments are always clear and concise tests are VERY easy just study textbook. She gives you tips on how to pass her class there are no hidden aspects that will surprise you. Her exams are now lockdown but she always online IDE. Relatively easy class, she also makes sure you're prepared for careers
Very lenient and contactable out of class. She wants her students to succeed and you will get good grades as long as you follow all the criteria.
Easy A in data structures, if you want to email her and ask her a question good luck because she will never respond.

She switched up her Data Structures class this semester and opted to go with a Zybook. The course was broken down haphazardly with 6-8 quizzes and 4 exams splitting up 15 weeks of material. She switched to all exams being under Lockdown browser this semester as we used an online IDE to code. She's easy to access by email and cares for her students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She gives really good advice, is understanding, and really wants all her students to succeed.

Prof. Perry has a genuine interest in making senior project a valuable experience for all students. Plus, she clearly wants students to succeed outside of the classroom. Gave very interesting lectures. Was always willing to talk to students about course content or career decisions. Used grader's, but grading was very fair.

Ms. Perry, is probably top 3 professors at KSU. I took her for cs 4850 senior project. She's really nice, but old school and straight forward. Her communication isn't the best, but she's always looking to improve and can funny at times too. Took her if you want a good senior project experience. She even extended many deadlines she didn't need to do

Honestly Perry is not at all a bad professor. She can be a bit picky when it comes to assignments or free-response questions but otherwise she seems like a very nice professor. I would say if you studied the textbook, ppt, quizzes, and programming practices that she has then the tests aren't too bad. It's basically just expanding from CSE 1322
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Online Savvy

comment: Prof Perry is very sweet but a horribly picky grader (TAs grade), I misnamed some files and failed on an assignment. No video lectures, just posts some poor quality videos from the guy who wrote the textbook. She seems genuinely nice & is very accessible, but data structures with her is basically self-teaching

She is unhelpful and unresponsive. She'd give you a vague response on whether or not the sky was green. She takes a whole letter grade of points off for minor mistakes like mislabeling a variable or the name of the files you turn in. She does not communicate expectations - ever.

I'm not sure who these good reviews are taking about but its not her. She's a super hard grader to the point that she will take 20 points off for the smallest thing, including naming your file wrong! Lots of assignments and practices, which is to be expected but how unreasonable she is in her grading is what gets me. I would avoid taking her!

One of the best and most caring professors that I have taken here at KSU. She really wants you to succeed in her class and she also is very easy going. Her exams are pretty straight forward, but her lectures can be kind of pointless since she just repeats what's on her slides. I would highly recommend her 10/10
Very Nice professor. Take her for concepts of programming languages if you can. Emphasizes on the essential aspect of the course rather than the all the fluffy theory.
Professor Perry is very straightforward, communicates well, and will always try her best to help her students.
Take her for the capstone project. She is the best!

Everything you need for this class is in the textbook, make sure you stay on top of the reading and practice the concepts. Lectures are YT lectures done by the author of the textbook which I never found helpful. The instructions for assignments are not very clear. She accepts late assignments and there's no lockdown except for on the final.

You only have 5 grades at 20% each. 2 tests, 1 final, quizzes, and assignments. The good news is, if you have an 80 or a 90 before the final there's no way you can even fail because everything is weighted at 20%. You would have to completely bomb if you have a 80 to even get a failing grade. She is very cool, usually replies fast and is funny.

I love her. She gives real world explanations for in class concepts. She also acknowledges that students need help and college is not representative of the work environment. She hates people on their phones and she hates groupme.

Take her. No questions asked. Any class, take her. She is such a personable person, shes intellectual, and shes informal. I love her with all my heart as a CS professor. She actually cares about the students and their performance. She gives life advice, college advice, and stories about her personal experiences.

Dr.Perry is one of the better professors in the cs department by far with her understanding the course martial. She sticks to an easy to follow schedule with enough wiggle room to turn in assignments that promote a better understanding of data structures. She is very approachable and in my personal experience allowed me to make up a lot of work.

Professor Perry was one of the first professor's I had where I felt like my concerns were really being heard. She worked hard to get me into a group I wanted to be in and even helped me over the phone on multiple occasions. There's a great energy to her and her class and I would recommend anyone taking 4850 give her a shot!

This is one of the very few professors in the CCSE that actually does justice to the term 'Professor'. She understands her duty to mentor/teach the students instead of simply reading off material, shows a desire to improve the CCSE, and shows desire for her students to succeed in their field. Very blunt/direct though, some spine necessary to play.
10/10 recommend. Had her for the senior project and it was a great class
She wrote her reviews. Took this class over the summer and she gave a lot of busy work. I would not take her.

It was her first time teaching this course. It was pretty thrown together and disorganized. Very easy A, and very nice, but I feel like I didn't learn a single thing from the class. There really weren't any lectures or teaching to speak of. Choose your prof based on what you want from that. Hopefully the class will improve if she teaches it again.

Prof Perry was awesome! She made it very clear that the content of the class was dry, so there were a handful of days where she gave career advice instead. The quizzes were open-note and she provided great study guides for the tests. The project was difficult, but it was split up into easier parts. I would definitely take her class again!

Excellent professor, she truly cares about student success and also really knows her stuff. The class I had her for was quite difficult, but she made how to succeed as a clear as possible and is always there to help or answer questions.

Perry is my favorite professor by far! Requirements for assignments and papers are clearly laid out. Quizzes are open note and exams are very straightforward from the study guide. You can tell that she really cares about the class. Just show up and turn your stuff in and you'll be fine. I would take a class from Perry every semester if I could!

Professor Perry is absolutely incredible. The class takes a little bit of effort, but she does everything to help you pass with flying colors. She pushes due dates back regularly, gives help with assignments, and grades easily. There are a few presentations and one big project chunked into digestible steps. Overall, a very fun professor!

you have to make a project every week, super hard ones, and if you say anything she says yea its a hard class deal with it. worst computer class I ever had the stress doesn't worse it. if you can just don't take her
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: worst professor ever, do yourself a favor and don't spend your time and money with her class, if you don't have to take that class this semester
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: She is extremely qualified and very relatable. She does a good job of conveying the information. Her assignment guidelines are very clear and can be easily met if you put in the effort. She is a fair graded and is forgiving. Im taking her again this semester. I recommend taking her class or hiring her.

Perry is one of those professors that will work with you. She is very caring and understanding. If I could take her for every single class I most definitely would. Just show up pay attention and you'll do fine without a doubt.

It was enjoyable to be in her class. Quizzes, tests and assignments do require you to use the book but they aren't too overbearing. She grades things very generously and cares about students' educations.

Prof Perry is one of the best professors I've had. She is honest and really cares about your education. Attendance isn't always necessary except for some lectures. She does use the textbook for all her quizzes and tests but provides really helpful study guides. If you have the option, definitely take her course because she is an amazing professor.

I got a poor grade because I turned in work late and didn't do the course project, so don't let it affect your decision to take this teacher. She is very kind and cares about the class. Attendance wasn't mandatory but it didn't hurt to show up once in a while (especially at the start and end of the semester). I highly recommend this professor.

She is very caring about her students. I took her for 2 classes which she was teaching this semester and she helped me a lot to learn. Professor Perry does not put pressure on her students and as a CS major if you Do not learn, you will suffer in job market. she gives a lot of insight about job market and preparing for interviews. great teacher!!!

Professor Perry is the easiest A I had in all of college. But don't let that take away from how great she is. She's super knowledgeable and knows a lot about CS. She genuinely cares about you passing her class and will go to basically any length to make that happen, as long as you try. Almost more of a mom than a professor. Gives great life advice.
Loved Prof. Perry's class. She was very helpful when I had questions. The assignments were very educational.

Prof. Perry is the best Computer Science professor I've had. I took her for Algorithm Analysis. She was essentially forced to teach 4-5 different classes after another long-time prof decided to retire a week before school started. She handled that challenge professionally and made sure everyone passed the course. Highly recommend!

Graded us on much less than the other data struct professors. She wasn't great teaching it, because she was replacing another prof, but she really tried. Always willing to help you out, and really wants students to pass and understand the content. Super fun professor, but more knowledgable in other classes.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Professor Perry is one of the better computer science professors I've had. She is very straight forward with her instructions and she cares about her students. She provided good information to help us find careers and she gave us meaningful assignments. I will take her again if I have the opportunity. She is a fair grader and helps you pass.

Professor Perry was substituted at the last minute due to some complication. She was, unfortunately, required by the department to teach 5 classes, and had to juggle between them, and this really did show (to which I fault the department more than her). Despite all this, she really cares for her students, and will do anything she can to help them.

Prof. Perry was a teacher who did the best with what she had after being given 7 classes to teach at the last minute by KSU. If she had more time to prep for the new classes I feel many complaints for some students wouldn't exist. She was also very clear about the situation we were in and tried to provide avenues of self-teaching to students.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Due to unfortunate events, she was forced to teach 5 classes this semester when she was only supposed to teach 1. However, I really believe she tried her best and she is a great professor. I would recommend anyone to take her whenever they can.

Perry was substituted last-minute for 2 classes (I took both), and it absolutely showed. She didn't really create any material for the classes, relying on other teachers' materials and for some class lectures, just reading straight out of the textbook. She does care about her students succeeding, but her actual classes left a lot to be desired

Prof Perry emphasizes parts of a class that will matter in your upcoming career. She has a lot of experience in the CS industry and it shows in her lectures. She's a fair grader and always willing to listen. She's also funny, real, and will make sure you're prepared for the industry. She routinely sends links to internships/articles. Very caring!

She teaches from slides she did not make. Assignments are not made by her and it showed. She calls her syllabus a "draft" which is a huge red flag, and would add projects and presentations that were not mentioned in it. She is willing to answer questions but can be a little rude sometimes. I would advice taking someone else if possible.
She is truly interested in her students progressing and takes her time to explain the material. An awesome professor!

She's great. I took the online summer class with no prior programming knowledge. I'm not sure what the issues were but communication was lacking. One instructor and two TA's and still no response for several days, sometimes not at all. Use the discussion boards. Feedback on labs is non-existent. Had no idea if I was doing it correctly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: A really good teacher.

Professor Perry was a great instructor. This was a senior level class, so she did not waste time with super detailed information on past subjects. The class was flexible and allowed each student to learn what the individual wanted to learn about internet programming. Overall one of my favorite classes.

This is the last taste of SPSU there is in this God forsaken corporate university called KSU. She is a breath of fresh air, Loving teacher, Motivating, and is honestly the teacher I reccomend to ANYONE Wanting to take her. TAKE THIS CLASS. Im gonna miss her. -A CoolGuy

Professor Perry is extremely helpful with any questions and assignments. Class was fun and very interesting. You'll learn a great deal in the class. She makes the class interesting and provides great information/tips about careers after graduation. I'd definitely recommend taking her if you need this class!

If you really wanna learn and get an easy A. She is it! She creates a very friendly environment and she is hilarious for sure. I don't like cramming books and taking tough tests for CS. However, in Prof. Perry's class, you'll do labs and she helps you out if you are in trouble. Also, project will be easy because of labs that you did. Best prof. !!!

Took her for internet programming. She answered questions fast and her assignments were pretty straight forward. Not a lot of HWs and Labs, so it's a fair amount of work. I like how she designed the final project to be any project you want to do, basically you can choose to improve your skills or show off your skills!
Great professor, definitely take her if you are doing internet programming... she makes the class fun and easy and she gives good advice for seniors about to enter the work force.

New to teaching, but a veteran in the CS field. Despite an admittedly rocky start to the semester, she only improved as a professor. If you have questions on what it's like outside of college with a CS degree, she has tons of experience. This class did have a LOT of assignments, but that's every CS1301 class.
Cool class and I learned alot as a new CS major. She was super helpful with all of my questions and I did work my butt off but it was worth it. I would take another class from her for sure.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Would take again

comment: If you're looking to take 1301 be sure to put in the effort to actually learn. This is an easy class to get all of the answers online but you're screwing yourself because the tests/finals are the biggest % of the grade. Sharon Perry is a good teacher if you go in knowing that most of what is taught is self-taught through the textbook and java labs
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: For me, the key to success in this class was the textbook. Read it thoroughly and this class becomes, in my opinion, an easy A. And because this class is taught in Java, you can easily find tutorials and help on the internet. If you want to receive all of the information you need while in class, this professor may not be the right fit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: I don't know what class these clowns were taking but this was one of the best classes and professors I've ever had. It is more work than any other class I ever took but it's the same material in all of the 1301 classes. There always seems to be some crybaby in class who doesn't want to do the work and needs to go back to HS
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough--Would take again

comment: Rude just straight up rude. I startted to fall behind on assignments and she goes on to tell me to drop out of college. She goves labs weekly adn assignments weekly so its not hard to fall behind.

Avoid at all cost. She is awful no other way to put it she gives you so many projects and dosnt teach and when you go to ask questions she sends you to the SIs and when they are busy she just tells you to wait. Then on test she gives you all wuestions over stuff thats in the text book but isnt.
